definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
cannot escape censure (idiom)/has to bear the blame
to say goodbye/to take one's leave

sentences.english: The fifth chapter mainly discusses its transfer during Wei and Jin dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 第五章主要討論相和歌辭在魏晉時期的轉型問題。

sentences.english: Forget my hair has been white, Confucius' Analects still recited.
sentences.chinese: 不記有白髮，猶誦論語辭。

sentences.english: So she quits and becomes a real estate agent.
sentences.chinese: 所以，她辭了職，變成了一名房地產經紀人。

sentences.english: The figure of speech "duplication" has two basic forms: duplicated words and morphological repetition.
sentences.chinese: 復疊辭格包括復辭和疊字兩種基本形式。

sentences.english: The chairman's short statementencapsulates the views of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 主席的簡短陳辭概括了委員會的觀點。

sentences.english: " still write down famously " lily magnolia demit " ?
sentences.chinese: 還記得聞名的《木蘭辭》嗎？

sentences.english: Carol resigned from the company because she was tired of playing second fiddle to George.
sentences.chinese: 卡羅爾向公司辭了職，因爲她再也不願聽命於喬治。

sentences.english: So I ended up by quiting my job.
sentences.chinese: 所以我最後還是辭了這份工作。

sentences.english: After marrying her demit the job, in home writing.
sentences.chinese: 結婚後她辭了工作，在家寫作。

sentences.english: Roughly speaking Su Dongpo used affairs and rhetoric in versifying.
sentences.chinese: 大體有用事與用辭兩端。

sentences.english: Minister to table with smell, and resigned not took office.
She gave the customary speech of thanks to the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 她照例向主席致感謝辭。

sentences.english: She resigned from to the manager without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 她二話沒說，立刻向經理辭了職。

to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
